qas.question: What is the language spoken by most Greeks?
Greeks who speak the Pontic dialect came from where?
Which Greek dialect is barely spoken currently?
From which language did the Tsakonian language derive?

context: Greece is today relatively homogeneous in linguistic terms, with a large majority of the native population using <a0_0>Greek<a0_0/> as their first or only language. Among the Greek-speaking population, speakers of the distinctive Pontic dialect came to Greece from <a1_0>Asia Minor<a1_0/> after the Greek genocide and constitute a sizable group. The <a2_0>Cappadocian<a2_0/> dialect came to Greece due to the genocide as well, but is endangered and is barely spoken now. Indigenous Greek dialects include the archaic Greek spoken by the Sarakatsani, traditionally transhument mountain shepherds of Greek Macedonia and other parts of Northern Greece. The Tsakonian language, a distinct Greek language deriving from <a3_0>Doric Greek<a3_0/> instead of Ionic Greek, is still spoken in some villages in the southeastern Peloponnese.
